alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 17 at 9:02PM AKDT until September 18 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * LOCATION...The Kuskokwim Delta coast. Highest water levels will be from Kipnuk north to Newtok. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise up to 4 feet above the normal highest tide line. * TIMING...Through 4 AM AKDT Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Low lying areas will continue to see flooding. Some shoreline erosion could occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will likely continue to come down through the overnight, but will take additional time to fully recede from inundated areas as onshore winds persist and gradually weaken. Water levels are expected to return below the normal high tide line early on Sunday morning.
info.instruction: A coastal flood warning means that flooding is occurring or imminent. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property.
